Hey guys, this might be stupid but just a thought.  Until they come up with tight 9 the 8 is working great for me, no problems at all with it.
	Second thing is this, take a copy of Norton ghost 2003 and make up a restore disk.  Then take and use Nero and burn an emulated bootable floppy onto your CD and copy the floppy disk files to the bootable CD.  Finally once you get your system and programs exactly the way you want to make a backup of your primary partition onto a backup partition.  Then proceed to install opus 9 and if the fucker fails just call your old image file with all you perfectly installed software and there will be zero trace of 9 and best of all it only takes about 3 minutes to recover everything.  Just a thought, it is what I do when I am going to test out new shit that I am not sure of.  When I used to program, especially fucking around with API, formating was second nature and the above method turned hours of work into minutes and there is no chance in hell of any trace of version 9 hiding shit when it was not included in the partition backup.  Make sure though you do your format and shit and setup everything but 9 before you make your ghost image using that CD and then use that same CD to restore if and when 9 fails.
